medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began drinking alcohol and using bath salts intranasally three days before admission after having no sleep and minimal oral intake. Agitation increased the night before admission, accompanied by auditory and visual hallucinations. On the morning of admission, after using more bath salts, the patient exhibited extreme agitation, paranoia, and was found running naked, claiming someone was trying to strangle him.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of depression, alcohol abuse, and drug abuse (including heroin, cocaine, and prescription opiates). Only medication was fluoxetine, which had not been taken for 2 weeks. Allergic to shellfish.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of hypertension, coronary artery disease, and diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked cigarettes. Lived with girlfriend and had recently lost his job.
